abstract:
<jats:title>Abstract</jats:title><jats:sec>
                <jats:title>Background</jats:title>
                <jats:p>Protein kinase C delta (<jats:italic>PRKCD</jats:italic>) and caspase recruitment domain family member 9 (<jats:italic>CARD9</jats:italic>) are genes involved in B and T cell activation, and cytokine production, which are vital mechanisms underlying autoimmune disease development. This study aimed to explore the association of the <jats:italic>PRKCD</jats:italic> and <jats:italic>CARD9</jats:italic> genes with Vogt–Koyanagi–Harada disease (VKH) disease. The case–control study was performed to in 912 patients with VKH and 878 normal controls. MassARRAY system, SHEsis online platform, real-time PCR, and enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay were used to detect genotyping, haplotyping, mRNA expression, and cytokine levels, respectively.</jats:p>
              </jats:sec><jats:sec>
                <jats:title>Results</jats:title>
                <jats:p>We found that rs74437127 C allele of <jats:italic>PRKCD</jats:italic>, rs3812555 CC genotype, and C allele of <jats:italic>CARD9</jats:italic> were associated with increased susceptibility of VKH (Pc = 0.020, OR = 1.624; Pc = 2.04 × 10<jats:sup>–5</jats:sup>, OR = 1.810; Pc = 2.76 × 10<jats:sup>–5</jats:sup>, OR = 1.698, respectively). However, the rs74437127 T allele, and rs3812555 TC genotype and T allele were linked with decreased susceptibility to VKH (Pc = 0.020, OR = 0.616; Pc = 7.85 × 10<jats:sup>–5</jats:sup>, OR = 0.559; Pc = 2.76 × 10<jats:sup>–5</jats:sup>, OR = 0.589, respectively). <jats:italic>PRKCD</jats:italic> ATG and <jats:italic>CARD9</jats:italic> GCTTA haplotypes decreased susceptibility to VKH (Pc = 3.11 × 10<jats:sup>–3</jats:sup>, OR = 0.594; Pc = 5.00 × 10<jats:sup>–3</jats:sup>, OR = 0.639, respectively). Functional studies on rs3812555 genotyped individuals revealed that CC carriers had significantly higher <jats:italic>CARD9</jats:italic> mRNA expression and tumour necrosis factor-α production than TC/TT carriers (<jats:italic>P</jats:italic> = 1.00 × 10<jats:sup>–4</jats:sup>; <jats:italic>P</jats:italic> = 2.00 × 10<jats:sup>–3</jats:sup>, respectively).</jats:p>
              </jats:sec><jats:sec>
                <jats:title>Conclusions</jats:title>
                <jats:p>We found an association between <jats:italic>PRKCD</jats:italic> rs74437127 and <jats:italic>CARD9</jats:italic> rs3812555 polymorphisms and VKH susceptibility and revealed that the increased susceptibility of rs3812555 for VKH may be mediated by regulating <jats:italic>CARD9</jats:italic> gene expression and the production of pro-inflammatory cytokines, such as TNF-α.</jats:p>
              </jats:sec>

group.label: Ethics approval and consent to participate
group.name: EthicsHeading

assertion.name: Ethics
assertion.value: All participants voluntarily signed an informed consent form before the collection of blood. This study was approved by the ethics committee of Chongqing Medical University (NO.2009–201008) and the Ethics Committee of the Second Affiliated Hospital of Fujian Medical University (NO.2019–110) and was carried out following the principles of the Declaration of Helsinki.

assertion.name: Ethics
assertion.value: All patients agreed to publish their data.

assertion.name: Ethics
assertion.value: All authors declare that they have no competing interests.
